summary: After worker restart, sticky execution queries and signals become unstable, causing workflow processes to be unavailable and signal handlers not to execute properly. The issue was caused by a RoadRunner version incompatibility and was resolved by updating to RR v2.10.3 and SDK v1.3.2.
userImpact: Workers crash or become stuck after restart, making workflow queries and signals unreliable in production environments.
rootCause: RoadRunner version incompatibility caused workflow process handles to not be properly maintained after worker restart, resulting in workflow processes being unavailable for query and signal operations.
proposedFix: Update RoadRunner to v2.10.3 and SDK to v1.3.2
resolutionDetails: Fixed by updating to RoadRunner v2.10.3 and temporalio/sdk-php v1.3.2, which resolved the process handle management issue after worker restart.
keyQuote: Workflow with the specified run identifier not found - sticky execution became unstable after worker restart causing crashes
